content: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another. This is known as the law of conservation of energy.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy, producing glucose and oxygen from carbon dioxide and water.
Water molecules consist of two hydrogen atoms bonded to one oxygen atom. The bent shape of water molecules gives water its unique properties.
When baking bread, yeast ferments sugars to produce carbon dioxide gas, which creates bubbles that make the dough rise.
In basketball, the optimal shooting angle for free throws is approximately 45 degrees, balancing arc height and distance.
Cognitive dissonance occurs when a person holds contradictory beliefs, ideas, or values, leading to psychological discomfort.
The Ship of Theseus paradox questions whether an object that has had all its components replaced remains fundamentally the same object.
In ecosystems, energy flows in one direction from producers to consumers, while nutrients cycle through the system.
Machine learning models learn patterns from data through iterative optimization of parameters to minimize prediction errors.
The printing press revolutionized information dissemination by making books affordable and widely available, accelerating the spread of knowledge.
